title: Walmart has downsized, closing 386 stores
body: This put 14 cashiers out of work

replies.body: 14 cashiers and 386 stores? How does that work?

> [{quoted}](name=14daysuspensionk,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=g8qd7yvg,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-01-14T19:33:42.423+0000)
>
> 14 cashiers and 386 stores? How does that work?

They're moving onto electronic cash registers now to try and save even more money from having to pay people. Though 14 is underestimation (and this the memes and games page so whatever) the only reason to have 1 person to man those electronic cash registers is to confirm age requirements are met with certain items.

> [{quoted}](name=14daysuspensionk,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=g8qd7yvg,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2019-01-14T22:42:49.993+0000)
>
> I'm not very used to these automated cash register things. They're basically non existant in grocery stores.

Lucky you. They're all over the place in grocery stores around here, and they're terrible. Instead of just scanning your items, paying, and moving on with your life, the system is filled with aggravating voice prompts and weird mechanisms (to catch shoplifters, maybe?), like a scale (I assume) in the "bagging area." Every time I try to use those things it's "HAVE YOU SCANNED YOUR CLUB CARD?" and "PLEASE PLACE YOUR ITEM IN THE BAGGING AREA" and then "UNEXPECTED ITEM IN THE BAGGING AREA" followed inevitably by "PLEASE WAIT FOR ASSISTANCE" good Lord they are so awful. I would 100% rather have a trusted, trained employee check my items. They don't have to deal with the "bagging area" nonsense, they know the codes for produce, they help with bagging, and I even get some basic human interaction.
Really? The ones I use don't even do anything, I just scan everything and put my card in and it's finished. It doesn't ask for any of that bullshit.
